cont.entity_a: Signal strength reduces with walls between devices.
cont.entity_b: Less range than older Netgear Wireless-G router.

cont.entity_a: Setup was very easy, but it does not work in shared mode. Easy to set up and use. Not suitable for users without IT knowledge for setup.
cont.entity_b: Setup is easy for users familiar with routers. Setup wizard on CD does not work with Windows XP. Setup is straightforward and easy to follow.

cont.entity_a: Excellent customer support from Netgear. Customer support is helpful for setup issues.
It does not work with DSL, even as the instructions say. Cannot be used directly with a DSL modem.
cont.entity_b: Does not connect with wireless N devices. Storage link does not work with NTFS formatted drives.

cont.entity_a: The router gets hot, so it should not be covered.
Lightweight with a carry case, suitable for travel.
After four months, the router stopped working and could not be repaired.
WPA configuration is quick, but WEP configuration is problematic.

cont.entity_b: Router crashes occasionally, requiring multiple reboots. Requires daily reboot for consistent performance. Firmware needs daily reboot due to performance issues.
Supports DD-WRT software with additional features.
Good range when it works. Wireless range is not better than G routers.
Firmware issues with NAT and wireless connections. Firmware needs improvement for better reliability.
USB storage features are limited and unreliable. USB attachment for shared disk drive is unreliable.
Price is reasonable for its features. Price was great at $65 but has connectivity issues.
